apps.allow_client_commands_desc: Whether to execute client prepare commands when running this app.
apps.app_name_desc: Application Name, as shown on Moonlight
apps.applications_desc: Applications are refreshed when a session is terminated.
apps.applications_reorder_desc: Drag and drop apps to reorder the apps. Any changes made will terminate the current running app.
apps.applications_tips:
Tip: You can also right click the launch app button to copy the launch link, and send it to your friends. They need to use Artemis and have already paired with you.
You can also double click the app name to export the app entry to a file, to add them to your favorite emulator frontends.
apps.auto_detach: Continue streaming if the application exits quickly
apps.auto_detach_desc: This will attempt to automatically detect launcher-type apps that close quickly after launching another program or instance of themselves. When a launcher-type app is detected, it is treated as a detached app.
apps.close_warning: Are you sure to terminate the current running app?
apps.cmd_desc: The main application to start. If blank, no application will be started.
apps.cmd_note: If the path to the command executable contains spaces, you must enclose it in quotes.
apps.cmd_prep_desc: A list of commands to be run before/after this application. If any of the prep-commands fail, starting the application is aborted.
apps.cmd_state_desc:
A list of commands to be run when resuming(first client connects when no clients are connected) or pausing(all clients disconnect) this application.
Do commands for resume and Undo command for pause.
Please make sure to clean up any side effects of the commands in the preparation undo commands.
Please note that pause command will not be executed when the session terminates.
apps.detached_cmds_desc: A list of commands to be run in the background.
apps.detached_cmds_note: If the path to the command executable contains spaces, you must enclose it in quotes.
apps.env_client_audio_config: The Audio Configuration requested by the client (2.0/5.1/7.1)
apps.env_client_enable_sops: The client has requested the option to optimize the game for optimal streaming (true/false)
apps.env_client_fps: The FPS requested by the client (float)
apps.env_client_gcmap: The requested gamepad mask, in a bitset/bitfield format (int)
apps.env_client_hdr: HDR is enabled by the client (true/false)
apps.env_client_height: The Height requested by the client (int)
apps.env_client_host_audio: The client has requested host audio (true/false)
apps.env_client_width: The Width requested by the client (int)
apps.env_client_uuid: UUID of the client starting the stream (string)
apps.env_client_name: Name of the client starting the stream (string)
apps.env_sunshine_compatibility: Environment variables starting with "SUNSHINE_" are deprecated but still kept for compatibility with Sunshine related tools. The SUNSHINE_CLIENT_FPS variable is modified to FLOAT for fractional refresh rate support(especially for Special-K), if your script/tool can't take floating number input, go to Advanced tab to enable "ENVVAR compatibility mode". APOLLO_CLIENT_FPS is always FLOAT type.
apps.env_vars_desc: All commands get these environment variables by default:
apps.exit_timeout_desc: Number of seconds to wait for all app processes to gracefully exit when requested to quit. If unset, the default is to wait up to 5 seconds. If set to zero or a negative value, the app will be immediately terminated.
apps.global_prep_desc: Enable/Disable the execution of Global Prep Commands for this application.
apps.global_state_desc: Enable/Disable the execution of Global Resume/Pause Commands for this application.
apps.image_desc: Application icon/picture/image path that will be sent to client. Image must be a PNG file. If not set, Apollo will send default box image.
apps.launch_local_client: Do you want to launch the app from local client on this device?
apps.launch_warning: Are you sure you want to launch this app? This will terminate the currently running app.
apps.name: Name
apps.output_desc: The file where the output of the command is stored, if it is not specified, the output is ignored
apps.per_client_app_identity_desc: Separate the app's identity per-client. Useful when you want different virtual display configurations on this specific app for different clients
apps.resolution_scale_factor_desc: Scale the client requested resolution based on this factor. e.g. 2000x1000 with a factor of 120% will become 2400x1200. Overrides client requested factor when the number isn't 100%. This option won't affect client requested streaming resolution.
apps.run_as_desc: This can be necessary for some applications that require administrator permissions to run properly. Might cause URL schemes to fail.
apps.terminate_on_pause_desc: Terminate the app when all clients are disconnected.
apps.use_app_identity_desc: Use the app's own identity while creating virtual displays instead of client's. This is useful when you want display configuration for each APP separately.
apps.virtual_display_desc: Always create a virtual display when starting this app, overriding client request. Please make sure the SudoVDA driver is installed and enabled.
apps.virtual_display_primary_desc: Automatically set the virtual display as primary display when the app starts. Virtual display will always be set to primary when client requests to use virtual display. (Recommended to keep on) [Broken on Windows 11 24H2]
apps.wait_all: Continue streaming until all app processes exit
apps.wait_all_desc: This will continue streaming until all processes started by the app have terminated. When unchecked, streaming will stop when the initial app process exits, even if other app processes are still running.
apps.working_dir_desc: The working directory that should be passed to the process. For example, some applications use the working directory to search for configuration files. If not set, Apollo will default to the parent directory of the command

client_card.clients_desc: Clients that are specifically tuned to work the best with Apollo
client_card.generic_moonlight_clients_desc: Generic Moonlight clients are still usable with Apollo.

config.adapter_name_desc_linux_1: Manually specify a GPU to use for capture.
config.adapter_name_desc_linux_2: to find all devices capable of VAAPI
config.adapter_name_desc_linux_3: Replace ``renderD129`` with the device from above to lists the name and capabilities of the device. To be supported by Apollo, it needs to have at the very minimum:
config.adapter_name_desc_windows: Manually specify a GPU to use for capture. If unset, the GPU is chosen automatically. We strongly recommend leaving this field blank to use automatic GPU selection! Note: This GPU must have a display connected and powered on. The appropriate values can be found using the following command:
config.address_family_desc: Set the address family used by Apollo
config.always_send_scancodes_desc: Sending scancodes enhances compatibility with games and apps but may result in incorrect keyboard input from certain clients that aren't using a US English keyboard layout. Enable if keyboard input is not working at all in certain applications. Disable if keys on the client are generating the wrong input on the host.
config.amd_coder_desc: Allows you to select the entropy encoding to prioritize quality or encoding speed. H.264 only.
config.amd_enforce_hrd_desc: Increases the constraints on rate control to meet HRD model requirements. This greatly reduces bitrate overflows, but may cause encoding artifacts or reduced quality on certain cards.
config.amd_preanalysis_desc: This enables rate-control preanalysis, which may increase quality at the expense of increased encoding latency.
config.amd_quality_desc: This controls the balance between encoding speed and quality.
config.amd_rc_cbr: cbr -- constant bitrate (recommended if HRD is enabled)
config.amd_rc_desc: This controls the rate control method to ensure we are not exceeding the client bitrate target. 'cqp' is not suitable for bitrate targeting, and other options besides 'vbr_latency' depend on HRD Enforcement to help constrain bitrate overflows.
config.amd_rc_vbr_latency: vbr_latency -- latency constrained variable bitrate (recommended if HRD is disabled; default)
config.amd_usage_desc: This sets the base encoding profile. All options presented below will override a subset of the usage profile, but there are additional hidden settings applied that cannot be configured elsewhere.
config.amd_vbaq_desc: The human visual system is typically less sensitive to artifacts in highly textured areas. In VBAQ mode, pixel variance is used to indicate the complexity of spatial textures, allowing the encoder to allocate more bits to smoother areas. Enabling this feature leads to improvements in subjective visual quality with some content.
config.apply_note: Click 'Apply' to restart Apollo and apply changes. This will terminate any running sessions.
config.audio_sink_desc_linux: The name of the audio sink used for Audio Loopback. If you do not specify this variable, pulseaudio will select the default monitor device. You can find the name of the audio sink using either command:
config.audio_sink_desc_macos: The name of the audio sink used for Audio Loopback. Apollo can only access microphones on macOS due to system limitations. To stream system audio using Soundflower or BlackHole.
config.audio_sink_desc_windows:
The audio device to be used when audio output is allowed on host by the client.
If unset, the device is chosen automatically.
You can get the Device ID using the following command:
config.auto_capture_sink_desc: Auto capture current sink after default audio sink changed.
config.av1_mode_0: Apollo will advertise support for AV1 based on encoder capabilities (recommended)
config.av1_mode_1: Apollo will not advertise support for AV1
config.av1_mode_2: Apollo will advertise support for AV1 Main 8-bit profile
config.av1_mode_3: Apollo will advertise support for AV1 Main 8-bit and 10-bit (HDR) profiles
config.av1_mode_desc: Allows the client to request AV1 Main 8-bit or 10-bit video streams. AV1 is more CPU-intensive to encode, so enabling this may reduce performance when using software encoding.
config.back_button_timeout_desc: If the Back/Select button is held down for the specified number of milliseconds, a Home/Guide button press is emulated. If set to a value < 0 (default), holding the Back/Select button will not emulate the Home/Guide button.
config.capture_desc: On automatic mode Apollo will use the first one that works. NvFBC requires patched nvidia drivers.
config.cert_desc: The certificate used for the web UI and Moonlight client pairing. For best compatibility, this should have an RSA-2048 public key.
config.channels_desc_1: Apollo can allow a single streaming session to be shared with multiple clients simultaneously.
config.channels_desc_2: Some hardware encoders may have limitations that reduce performance with multiple streams.
config.coder_cabac: cabac -- context adaptive binary arithmetic coding - higher quality
config.coder_cavlc: cavlc -- context adaptive variable-length coding - faster decode
config.controller_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with a gamepad / controller
config.credentials_file_desc: Store Username/Password separately from Apollo's state file.
config.dd_config_ensure_only_display: Deactivate other displays and activate only the specified display
config.dd_config_ensure_primary: Activate the display automatically and make it a primary display
config.dd_config_revert_delay_desc: Additional delay in milliseconds to wait before reverting configuration when the app has been closed or the last session terminated. Main purpose is to provide a smoother transition when quickly switching between apps.
config.dd_config_revert_on_disconnect_desc: Revert configuration upon disconnect of all clients instead of app close or last session termination.
config.dd_config_verify_only: Verify that the display is enabled
config.dd_hdr_option_auto: Switch on/off the HDR mode as requested by the client (default)
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_1: Specify remapping entries to change the requested resolution and/or refresh rate to other values.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_2: The list is iterated from top to bottom and the first match is used.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_3: "Requested" fields can be left empty to match any requested value.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_4_final_values_mi: At least one "Final" field must be specified. The unspecified resolution or refresh rate will not be changed.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_4_final_values_no: "Final" field must be specified and cannot be empty.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_5_sops_mixed_only: "Optimize game settings" option must be enabled in the Moonlight client, otherwise entries with any resolution fields specified are skipped.
config.dd_mode_remapping_desc_5_sops_resolution: "Optimize game settings" option must be enabled in the Moonlight client, otherwise the mapping is skipped.
config.dd_refresh_rate_option_auto: Use FPS value provided by the client (default)
config.dd_refresh_rate_option_manual_desc: Enter the refresh rate to be used
config.dd_resolution_option_auto: Use resolution provided by the client (default)
config.dd_resolution_option_manual_desc: Enter the resolution to be used
config.dd_resolution_option_ogs_desc: "Optimize game settings" option must be enabled on the Moonlight client for this to work.
config.dd_resolution_option_vdisplay_desc: Not recommended to use this option on usual circumstances. Please use native Windows settings to change display configurations. When using virtual display, only built-in resolution and client requested resolution/refresh rate will work.
config.dd_resolution_option_multi_instance_desc: When using multiple instance of Apollo, make sure you have disabled this option in all instances, or it'll end up messing things up. It's still recommended to disable this part if you don't want your physical monitor's resolution to change or you only stream with virtual display.
config.dd_wa_hdr_toggle_delay_desc_1: When using virtual display device (VDD) for streaming, it might incorrectly display HDR color. Apollo can try to mitigate this issue, by turning HDR off and then on again.
config.dd_wa_hdr_toggle_delay_desc_2: If the value is set to 0, the workaround is disabled (default). If the value is between 0 and 3000 milliseconds, Apollo will turn off HDR, wait for the specified amount of time and then turn HDR on again. The recommended delay time is around 500 milliseconds in most cases.
config.dd_wa_hdr_toggle_delay_desc_3: DO NOT use this workaround unless you actually have issues with HDR as it directly impacts stream start time!
config.double_refreshrate: Double refresh rate for Virtual Display
config.double_refreshrate_desc: Double the requested refresh rate when creating virtual displays, streamed refresh rate still remain the same. Can potentially improve stutter problem on some systems.
config.ds4_back_as_touchpad_click_desc: When forcing DS4 emulation, map Back/Select to Touchpad Click
config.enable_discovery_desc: When disabled, you'll need to manually enter host IP on the client to pair.
config.enable_input_only_mode_desc: Add an Input Only app entry. When enabled, the app list will only show the current running app and the Input Only entry when streaming. The Input Only entry will not receive any image or audio. Useful for operating the desktop on TV or connecting peripherals which the TV doesn't support with a phone.
config.enable_pairing_desc: Enable pairing for the Moonlight client. This allows the client to authenticate with the host and establish a secure connection.
config.encoder_desc: Force a specific encoder, otherwise Apollo will select the best available option. Note: If you specify a hardware encoder on Windows, it must match the GPU where the display is connected.
config.envvar_compatibility_mode_desc: Enable compatibility mode for environment variables. This will modify the behavior of certain environment variables to be more compatible with older tools.
config.external_ip_desc: If no external IP address is given, Apollo will automatically detect external IP
config.fallback_mode_desc: Apollo will use this mode when the client does not provide a mode or when the app is launched through the web UI. Format: [Width]x[Height]x[FPS]
config.fec_percentage_desc: Percentage of error correcting packets per data packet in each video frame. Higher values can correct for more network packet loss, but at the cost of increasing bandwidth usage.
config.file_apps_desc: The file where current apps of Apollo are stored.
config.file_state_desc: The file where current state of Apollo is stored
config.gamepad_desc: Choose which type of gamepad to emulate on the host
config.global_prep_cmd_desc: Configure a list of commands to be executed before or after running any application. If any of the specified preparation commands fail, the application launch process will be aborted.
config.global_state_cmd_desc:
Configure a list of commands to be executed when resuming(first client connects when no clients are connected) or pausing(all clients disconnect) any application.
Do commands for resume and Undo command for pause.
Please make sure to clean up any side effects of the commands in the preparation undo commands.
Please note that pause command will not be executed when the session terminates.
config.headless_mode_desc: Start Apollo in headless mode. When enabled, all apps will start in virtual display.
config.hevc_mode_0: Apollo will advertise support for HEVC based on encoder capabilities (recommended)
config.hevc_mode_1: Apollo will not advertise support for HEVC
config.hevc_mode_2: Apollo will advertise support for HEVC Main profile
config.hevc_mode_3: Apollo will advertise support for HEVC Main and Main10 (HDR) profiles
config.hevc_mode_desc: Allows the client to request HEVC Main or HEVC Main10 video streams. HEVC is more CPU-intensive to encode, so enabling this may reduce performance when using software encoding.
config.hide_tray_controls_desc: Do not show "Force Stop", "Restart" and "Quit" in tray menu.
config.high_resolution_scrolling_desc: When enabled, Apollo will pass through high resolution scroll events from Moonlight clients. This can be useful to disable for older applications that scroll too fast with high resolution scroll events.
config.ignore_encoder_probe_failure_desc: Allow streaming to continue even if probing for encoders fails. This may result in streaming failure if no encoder is available.
config.install_steam_audio_drivers_desc: If Steam is installed, this will automatically install the Steam Streaming Speakers driver to support 5.1/7.1 surround sound and muting host audio.
config.isolated_virtual_display_option: Move the Virtual Display to the bottom right-most corner of the display layout
config.isolated_virtual_display_option_desc: This makes the display isolated from all other display and contains mouse movements to the virtual screen. This reorganizes the displays such that the all other displays are to the left of the virtual display.
config.keep_sink_default_desc: Whether to force selected virtual sink as default (effective when host audio output is disabled).
config.key_repeat_delay_desc: Control how fast keys will repeat themselves. The initial delay in milliseconds before repeating keys.
config.key_repeat_frequency_desc: How often keys repeat every second. This configurable option supports decimals.
config.key_rightalt_to_key_win: Map Right Alt key to Windows key
config.key_rightalt_to_key_win_desc: It may be possible that you cannot send the Windows Key from Moonlight directly. In those cases it may be useful to make Apollo think the Right Alt key is the Windows key
config.keyboard_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with the keyboard
config.lan_encryption_mode_desc: This determines when encryption will be used when streaming over your local network. Encryption can reduce streaming performance, particularly on less powerful hosts and clients.
config.legacy_ordering_desc: Enable ordering support workaround for legacy clients. Can cause issues with clients or scripts that can't handle UTF8 correctly. Artemis clients support this by default.
config.limit_framerate_desc: Limit the framerate being captured to client requested framerate. May not run at full framerate if vsync is enabled and display refreshrate does not match requested framerate. Could cause lag on some clients if disabled.
config.locale_desc: The locale used for Apollo's user interface.
config.min_log_level_desc: The minimum log level printed to standard out
config.log_path_desc: The file where the current logs of Apollo are stored.
config.max_bitrate_desc: The maximum bitrate (in Kbps) that Apollo will encode the stream at. If set to 0, it will always use the bitrate requested by the client.
config.minimum_fps_target_desc: The lowest effective FPS a stream can reach. Set 0 for automatic.
config.min_threads_desc: Increasing the value slightly reduces encoding efficiency, but the tradeoff is usually worth it to gain the use of more CPU cores for encoding. The ideal value is the lowest value that can reliably encode at your desired streaming settings on your hardware.
config.motion_as_ds4: Emulate a DS4 gamepad if the client gamepad reports motion sensors are present
config.motion_as_ds4_desc: If disabled, motion sensors will not be taken into account during gamepad type selection.
config.mouse_desc: Allows guests to control the host system with the mouse
config.native_pen_touch_desc: When enabled, Apollo will pass through native pen/touch events from Moonlight clients. This can be useful to disable for older applications without native pen/touch support.
config.notify_pre_releases_desc: Whether to be notified of new pre-release versions of Apollo
config.nvenc_h264_cavlc: Prefer CAVLC over CABAC in H.264
config.nvenc_h264_cavlc_desc: Simpler form of entropy coding. CAVLC needs around 10% more bitrate for same quality. Only relevant for really old decoding devices.
config.nvenc_intra_refresh_desc: Enable Intra Refresh for some clients to render correctly continuously (e.g. Xbox Client)
config.nvenc_latency_over_power: Prefer lower encoding latency over power savings
config.nvenc_latency_over_power_desc: Apollo requests maximum GPU clock speed while streaming to reduce encoding latency. Disabling it is not recommended since this can lead to significantly increased encoding latency.
config.nvenc_opengl_vulkan_on_dxgi: Present OpenGL/Vulkan on top of DXGI
config.nvenc_opengl_vulkan_on_dxgi_desc: Apollo can't capture fullscreen OpenGL and Vulkan programs at full frame rate unless they present on top of DXGI. This is system-wide setting that is reverted on Apollo program exit.
config.nvenc_preset_desc: Higher numbers improve compression (quality at given bitrate) at the cost of increased encoding latency. Recommended to change only when limited by network or decoder, otherwise similar effect can be accomplished by increasing bitrate.
config.nvenc_realtime_hags: Use realtime priority in hardware accelerated gpu scheduling
config.nvenc_realtime_hags_desc: Currently NVIDIA drivers may freeze in encoder when HAGS is enabled, realtime priority is used and VRAM utilization is close to maximum. Disabling this option lowers the priority to high, sidestepping the freeze at the cost of reduced capture performance when the GPU is heavily loaded.
config.nvenc_spatial_aq_desc: Assign higher QP values to flat regions of the video. Recommended to enable when streaming at lower bitrates.
config.nvenc_twopass_desc: Adds preliminary encoding pass. This allows to detect more motion vectors, better distribute bitrate across the frame and more strictly adhere to bitrate limits. Disabling it is not recommended since this can lead to occasional bitrate overshoot and subsequent packet loss.
config.nvenc_vbv_increase_desc: By default Apollo uses single-frame VBV/HRD, which means any encoded video frame size is not expected to exceed requested bitrate divided by requested frame rate. Relaxing this restriction can be beneficial and act as low-latency variable bitrate, but may also lead to packet loss if the network doesn't have buffer headroom to handle bitrate spikes. Maximum accepted value is 400, which corresponds to 5x increased encoded video frame upper size limit.
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_desc: The origin of the remote endpoint address that is not denied access to Web UI
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_lan: Only those in LAN may access Web UI
config.origin_web_ui_allowed_pc: Only localhost may access Web UI
config.output_name_desc_unix: During Apollo startup, you should see the list of detected displays. Note: You need to use the id value inside the parenthesis. Below is an example; the actual output can be found in the Troubleshooting tab.
config.output_name_desc_windows: Manually specify a display device id to use for capture. If unset, the primary display is captured. Note: If you specified a GPU above, this display must be connected to that GPU. During Apollo startup, you should see the list of detected displays. Below is an example; the actual output can be found in the Troubleshooting tab.
config.ping_timeout_desc: How long to wait in milliseconds for data from moonlight before shutting down the stream
config.pkey_desc: The private key used for the web UI and Moonlight client pairing. For best compatibility, this should be an RSA-2048 private key.
config.port_desc: Set the family of ports used by Apollo
config.port_http_port_note: Use this port to connect with Moonlight.
config.port_warning: Exposing the Web UI to the internet is a security risk! Proceed at your own risk!
config.qp_desc: Some devices may not support Constant Bit Rate. For those devices, QP is used instead. Higher value means more compression, but less quality.
config.qsv_slow_hevc_desc: This can enable HEVC encoding on older Intel GPUs, at the cost of higher GPU usage and worse performance.
config.restart_note: Apollo is restarting to apply changes.
config.server_cmd_desc: Configure a list of commands to be executed when called from client during streaming.
config.stream_audio_desc: Whether to stream audio or not. Disabling this can be useful for streaming headless displays as second monitors.
config.sunshine_name_desc: The name displayed by Moonlight. If not specified, the PC's hostname is used
config.sw_preset_desc: Optimize the trade-off between encoding speed (encoded frames per second) and compression efficiency (quality per bit in the bitstream). Defaults to superfast.
config.sw_tune_animation: animation -- good for cartoons; uses higher deblocking and more reference frames
config.sw_tune_desc: Tuning options, which are applied after the preset. Defaults to zerolatency.
config.sw_tune_fastdecode: fastdecode -- allows faster decoding by disabling certain filters
config.sw_tune_film: film -- use for high quality movie content; lowers deblocking
config.sw_tune_grain: grain -- preserves the grain structure in old, grainy film material
config.sw_tune_zerolatency: zerolatency -- good for fast encoding and low-latency streaming (default)
config.system_tray_desc: Whether to show Apollo icon in the system tray
config.touchpad_as_ds4: Emulate a DS4 gamepad if the client gamepad reports a touchpad is present
config.touchpad_as_ds4_desc: If disabled, touchpad presence will not be taken into account during gamepad type selection.
config.upnp_desc: Automatically configure port forwarding for streaming over the Internet
config.vaapi_strict_rc_buffer: Strictly enforce frame bitrate limits for H.264/HEVC on AMD GPUs
config.vaapi_strict_rc_buffer_desc: Enabling this option can avoid dropped frames over the network during scene changes, but video quality may be reduced during motion.
config.virtual_sink_desc:
The audio device to be used when audio output isn't allowed on host by the client.
If unset, the device is chosen automatically.
We strongly recommend leaving this field blank to use automatic device selection!
config.wan_encryption_mode_desc: This determines when encryption will be used when streaming over the Internet. Encryption can reduce streaming performance, particularly on less powerful hosts and clients.

index.description: Apollo is a self-hosted game stream host for Moonlight.
index.installed_version_not_stable: You are running a pre-release version of Apollo. You may experience bugs or other issues. Please report any issues you encounter. Thank you for helping to make Apollo a better software!
index.new_pre_release: A new Pre-Release Version is Available!
index.new_stable: A new Stable Version is Available!
index.startup_errors: Attention! Apollo detected these errors during startup. We STRONGLY RECOMMEND fixing them before streaming.
index.version_dirty: Thank you for helping to make Apollo a better software!
index.version_latest: You are running the latest version of Apollo

password.new_username_desc: If not specified, the username will not change
password.success_msg: Password has been changed successfully! This page will reload soon, your browser will ask you for the new credentials.

pin.allow_client_commands_desc: Allow client commands to be executed when connecting to this device.
pin.always_use_virtual_display_desc: Always create a virtual display when connecting from this device.
pin.client_do_cmd_desc: Commands to be executed when client connects. All of the commands are executed detached.
pin.client_undo_cmd_desc: Commands to be executed when client disconnects. All of the commands are executed detached.
pin.display_mode_override_desc: Apollo will ignore client requested display mode and use this value to configure (virtual) displays. Leave blank for auto matching. Format: [Width]x[Height]x[FPS]
pin.enable_legacy_ordering_desc: Enable app ordering for legacy clients. Disable if this client can't handle UTF8 correctly. Needs to enable "App ordering for legacy clients" in the Advanced settings.
pin.pair_failure: Pairing Failed: Check if the PIN is typed correctly
pin.pair_success: Success! Please check Moonlight to continue
pin.pair_success_check_perm: Pair success! Please grant necessary permissions to the client manually below.
pin.warning_msg: Make sure you have access to the client you are pairing with. This software can give total control to your computer, so be careful!
pin.otp_expired_msg: OTP expired. Please request a new one.
pin.otp_success: PIN request success, the PIN is available within 3 minutes.
pin.otp_msg: OTP pairing is only available for the latest Artemis clients. Please use legacy pairing method for other clients.
pin.otp_pair_now: PIN generated successfully, do you want to pair now?
pin.device_management_desc: Manage your paired devices and their permissions.
pin.device_management_warning: The first paired device will have full permissions by default. Other newly paired devices will have limited permissions set by default.
pin.unpair_single_success: However, the device(s) may still be in an active session. Use the 'Force Close' button above to end any open sessions.

resource_card.legal_desc: By continuing to use this software you agree to the terms and conditions in the following documents.

troubleshooting.dd_reset_desc: If Apollo is stuck trying to restore the changed display device settings, you can reset the settings and proceed to restore the display state manually.
troubleshooting.force_close_desc: If Moonlight complains about an app currently running, force closing the app should fix the issue. This will also reload the App list.
troubleshooting.logs_desc: See the logs uploaded by Apollo
troubleshooting.restart_apollo_desc: If Apollo isn't working properly, you can try restarting it. This will terminate any running sessions.
troubleshooting.quit_apollo_desc: Exit Apollo. This will terminate any running sessions.
troubleshooting.quit_apollo_confirm: Do you really want to quit Apollo? You'll not be able to start Apollo again if you have no other methods to operate your computer.

welcome.create_creds: Before Getting Started, we need you to make a new username and password for accessing the Web UI.
welcome.create_creds_alert: The credentials below are needed to access Apollo's Web UI. Keep them safe, since you will never see them again!
welcome.welcome_success: This page will reload soon, your browser will ask you for the new credentials
